A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This movie succeeded wildly. If the goal was to destroy the legacy of the original trilogy and Luke Skywalker. It’s not even solely the narrative choices Rian Johnson went with that killed this movie\, it’s how poorly it was all done. Plot holes were everywhere\, character development was forgotten or even worse...what was established in previous movies was undone and wasted\, the plot was so lazily written that the movie actually felt boring and nonsensical with completely pointless storylines\, and to top it all off...the character of Luke was utterly savaged and unrecognizable. At this point they might as well call this what it is... a shoddy remake of the original trilogy that steals every major plot point and would have you believe that simply slightly altering scenes from past movies as compelling new twists. It’s telling when Mark Hamill himself hated the direction taken for Luke in this movie. And I thought Star Wars hit its lowest with The Phantom Menace...and here came The Last Jedi to prove how completely wrong I was.
